While app-store sales are promising  a real turnaround hinges on the success of its much-anticipated  10th-anniversary smartphone.

Headline: UPDATE 1-Apple touches record as brokerages bullish on iPhone X demand
Article: Oct 30 Several analysts downplayed concerns about Apple Inc's iPhone X production issues and were bullish on demand and sales  pushing the company's shares to a record on Monday.

Headline: Brokerages bullish on iPhone X demand after Apple hint
Article: Oct 30 Signs of strong demand for Apple's iPhone X led one well-known sector analyst to raise his forecast for pre-orders by 10 million on Monday and another to predict iPhone sales overall next year would be higher than consensus forecasts.

Headline: GLOBAL MARKETS-Asia shares get tech boost from Apple  crude near 2-year high
Article: SYDNEY  Oct 30 Asian shares climbed on Monda  as technology stocks were bolstered by solid earnings from U.S. stalwarts and on strong pre-orders for Apple's iPhone X  while oil hovered around a 2-year peak on concerns of tightening supplies.

Headline: Apple suppliers jump in Japan but weak financials leave Nikkei flat
Article: TOKYO  Oct 30 Japan's Nikkei share average made little headway in choppy trade on Monday  with gains in suppliers to Apple Inc offset by selling in financials and caution ahead of major central bank meetings this week.

Headline: Nikkei edges lower  financials offset gains in Apple suppliers
Article: TOKYO  Oct 30 Japan's Nikkei share average edged down in choppy trade on Monday morning as falls in financials countered gains in Apple suppliers after shares in the iPhone maker soared on Friday.

Headline: Apple could drop Qualcomm components in next year's iPhones  iPads: sources
Article: Apple Inc  has designed iPhones and iPads that would drop chips supplied by Qualcomm Inc   according to two people familiar with the matter. | Video

Headline: Qualcomm dips on risk of losing Apple  Intel gains
Article: Shares in Qualcomm Inc  fell as much as 8 percent on Tuesday on reports that Apple Inc  would not use its modem chips in iPhones and iPads from next year.

Headline: UPDATE 1-Qualcomm dips on risk of losing Apple  Intel gains

Headline: RPT-Apple X factor: China buyers rapt by new iPhone  but will they buy?
Article: SHANGHAI/BEIJING  Nov 1 Gu Xiaomeng  a 24-year-old primary school teacher in the eastern Chinese city of Suzhou  says she's excited about the new iPhone X  set to go on sale on Friday. The challenge for Apple Inc is to persuade her to actually buy one.

Headline: Irish court rejects appeal against $1 billion Apple data center
Article: DUBLIN Ireland's High Court on Wednesday rejected an appeal against Apple's plans to build an 850 million euro ($1 billion)data center in Ireland  clearing the way for the project to proceed.

Headline: Irish court rejects appeal against $1 bln Apple data centre
Article: DUBLIN  Nov 1 Ireland's High Court on Wednesday rejected an appeal against Apple's plans to build an 850 million euro ($1 billion)data centre in Ireland  clearing the way for the project to proceed.

Headline: UPDATE 11-Apple sees strong holiday sales  smooth sailing for iPhone X
Article: SAN FRANCISCO  Nov 2 Apple Inc on Thursday reported better-than-expected earnings and offered a rosy forecast for the holiday shopping season  allaying investor concerns about production delays on the new iPhone X and demonstrating remarkable strength across its growing line of products and services.

Headline: Apple's holiday-quarter sales forecast largely above estimates
Article: Nov 2 Apple Inc's revenue forecast for the holiday shopping-quarter was largely above market expectations  helping allay investor concerns about production delays and supply constraints for the iPhone X  which it will start shipping from Nov. 3.

Headline: Qualcomm sues Apple for breach of software license contract
Article: Qualcomm Inc  has sued Apple Inc   alleging that it violated a software license contract to benefit rival chipmaker Intel Corp  for making broadband modems  the latest salvo in the longstanding dispute between Qualcomm and Apple.

Headline: UPDATE 5-Qualcomm sues Apple for breach of software license contract
Article: Nov 2 Qualcomm Inc has sued Apple Inc   alleging that it violated a software license contract to benefit rival chipmaker Intel Corp for making broadband modems  the latest salvo in the longstanding dispute between Qualcomm and Apple.

Article: Nov 2 Qualcomm Inc has sued Apple Inc   alleging that it violated a software license contract to benefit rival chipmaker Intel for making broadband modems  the latest salvo in a longstanding dispute between the two companies.

Headline: Apple draws options bulls ahead of quarterly results
Article: NEW YORK Ahead of Apple Inc's quarterly report on Thursday  traders in the options market have taken positions close to the most bullish since late December  options data showed.

Headline: Apple juices Wall St. as indexes climb for another week
Article: A surge in shares of heavyweight Apple helped push up major Wall Street indexes on Friday  as investors also assessed a mixed U.S. labor market report. | Video

Headline: Long lines for iPhone X help push Apple shares to record high
Article: NEW YORK/FRANKFURT Shoppers surged into Apple Inc stores across the world on Friday to buy the new iPhone X  signaling stronger demand for the 10th anniversary version of the premium smartphone than the last two iterations. | Video

Headline: Apple's iPhone X has higher margin than iPhone 8: analysis
Article: Apple Inc's  new flagship iPhone X makes the company more money per phone than its iPhone 8 model  according to an analysis  which found the iPhone X's flashier parts cost Apple 25 percent more than the iPhone 8  but that it retailed 43 percent higher.

Headline: Apple's iPhone X has higher margin than iPhone 8 -analysis
Article: Nov 6 Apple Inc's new flagship iPhone X makes the company more money per phone than its iPhone 8 model  according to an analysis  which found the iPhone X's flashier parts cost Apple 25 percent more than the iPhone 8  but that it retailed 43 percent higher.

Headline: Irish PM says future of $1 billion Apple data center uncertain
Article: DUBLIN A planned $1 billion Apple data center is in doubt after Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said the U.S. company's Chief Executive Tim Cook would no longer commit to it  adding that Dublin would do whatever necessary to get it built.

Headline: Supreme Court rejects Samsung appeal of patent loss to Apple
Article: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday refused to step back into the years-long feud over patents between the world's top smartphone makers  declining to hear Samsung's  appeal of a lower court ruling that reinstated a jury award of about $120 million in favor of Apple.

Headline: UPDATE 1-U.S. top court rejects Samsung appeal of patent loss to Apple
Article: Nov 6 The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday refused to step back into the years-long feud over patents between the world's top smartphone makers  declining to hear Samsung's appeal of a lower court ruling that reinstated a jury award of about $120 million in favor of Apple.

Headline: EU's Vestager seeking details on Apple's recent tax set-up
Article: LISBON European Union regulators have asked iPhone maker Apple for details of its recent tax structure following last year's order to pay back taxes of up to 13 billion euros ($15 billion) to Ireland  Europe's anti-trust chief said on Tuesday.

Headline: Apple says no operations were moved from Ireland
Article: Apple Inc said none of its operations were moved from Ireland and that changes made to its corporate structure in 2015 were specially designed to preserve tax payments to the United States  and not to reduce taxes anywhere else. | Video

Article: LOS ANGELES Apple Inc  has ordered two seasons of a dramatic series that stars Reese Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston and looks at the lives of people working on a morning television show  a company spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Breakingviews - Apple has deciding vote in Broadcom-Qualcomm deal
Article: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Apple may anoint the winner of Broadcom's $105 billion bid for Qualcomm. A dispute over iPhone royalties left the U.S. chipmaker vulnerable to an opportunistic offer from its acquisitive rival. Settling could preserve Qualcomm’s independence – but it all depends on whether Apple thinks a bigger Broadcom would be slavishly devoted to the handset maker  or just surlier.
